guardian.title: Greece warned to expect no favours as bailout negotiations begin
guardian.topComment:
First, they had years of low-interest financing through the euro to support the country-wide reckless overspending.
Then they had huge haircuts, repeated bridging strategies and a multitude of special cases made just for them.
And yet, Greece and its...

guardian.title: Arab nations united in fury against Isis but divided on strategy
guardian.topComment: If the Middle East united around their common humanity, and dropped their ethnic and religious divisions, they could not only purge ISIS in an afternoon, but also become a serious international player.
